summary: The Patent Eligibility Restoration Act of 2025 aims to clarify and expand patent eligibility in the United States. It addresses judicial exceptions to patent eligibility under 35 U.S.C. § 101, specifying what inventions are eligible (useful processes, machines, manufactures, or compositions of matter) and what are excluded (e.g., mathematical formulas, mental processes, unmodified human genes/natural materials, and certain processes). The bill also modifies definitions and provides guidelines for determining eligibility, including the consideration of the invention as a whole and the role of machines in practical application. It proposes changes to U.S. Code Title 35 to effect the changes.
